page.title: 10TRANSPORT
page.content: A bus garage is situated in our village(Law).The name of the company is Irvine of Law and they own 18 buses.Each service bus has a conductress.It costs Â£50 to pay the drivers and conductresses each per day.Both drivers and conductresses work up to 8 hours on each service bus a day.On single buses 53 passengers can be seated,while the double deckers carry 82 passengers.The drivers drive up to 316.8 miles per day.Throughout the day approximately 800 people travel on service buses. Irvine buy their buses from all kinds of dealers over Scotland and England. We were surprised to find that although a bus is about twice as large as a car,the tax is the same.The buses vary from 36-40 feet. Hutchison operate a similar service in Overtown.
